subject: Testing a method that takes objects as parameters
msgSnippet: ... I don t understand why this /specifically/ is a problem. To test a method, pass it some known values as parameters, then compare the value the method
messageBody:
athipalli suneel wrote:

> Plz keep the above mentioned and give me any suggestions how can
> we test the methods that are taking objects as parameters using Junit ?

I don't understand why this /specifically/ is a problem. To test a
method, pass it some known values as parameters, then compare the value
the method returns with your expectation.

Here is a simple example of a class-level method taking an object as a
parameter:

assertEquals("HELLO", StringUtil.upcase("hello"));

Does this help?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
